result.execSummary:
The defendant Mason J. Westman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Restitution

Defendant Mason J. Westman in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Frank states matter is resolved.  State states recommendations.  Atty Frank is in agreement and NC plea entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Parties review VIS.  State makes statement.  Atty Frank makes statement.  Court sentences.

Ct 1:  
$453.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 30 days or set up payment plan w/Clerk's Office
$158.98 restitution to Viking plus all applicable surcharges to be paid to Clerk's Office w/in 30 days or set up payment plan
Expungement if successful

body
Defendant Mason J. Westman not in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.
